Reviews.Title: “Huge room, stylish&cozy bar/restaurant, but noisy&overpriced”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteElisa
Reviews.Content: There is just something about the Soho Houses... Their style and vibe does work... The hotel room in New York was huge (especially for NYC standards), but not my favourite. It lacked some old bits and pieces, i.e. the 'vintage balance' that -in my opinion- is key to the 'Soho-style' together with a modern and simplistic touch. Also, you can't open the window, which doesn't particularly improve the air in the room... But the real problem was the noise. Of course the meat packing district is a busy area (especially at night), but you would expect the hotel walls and -windows to be able to at least somehow keep up with it... The bar and restaurant are lovely. Great sense of style and very cosy -together with the fireplace, etc... Food and drinks were good ( but unfortunately overpriced, as the rest...) The rooftop pool of course is also a very welcome bonus. Staff was friendly, but not outstanding ( we had several issues with our TV - no solution, nor apology, and they forgot returning one of our bags which we left in the luggage room on the day of our departure -luckily we noticed only several minutes away from the hotel in the cab on our way to the airport...). To be honest, I think next time I'd choose a different hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Really special and cool property in the meat packing district”
Reviews.Author: Cindy C
Reviews.Content: It's super stylish and the restaurant on the 6th floor, the library, the pool and restaurant upstairs, the Cowshed spa and little gym -- all of that makes it well worth the money in my mind, plus you are right in the heart of a great area. If you want a real New York experience that is like a club and hotel in one, go here. It's a little more expensive to non-members but still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of hype”
Reviews.Author: markmDanville_Ca_
Reviews.Content: Exclusivity has its privileges... not really. The Mac & Cheese was luke warm and tasteless, the burger dull. We ordered flatbreads and empanadas as app's... they came from costco's frozen food section... The alcohol is expensive... people pay to be a member ? The service was attentive and competent, the atmosphere was pseudo NYC hip with only a few people speaking loudly about their next "big deal". Won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Soho House”
Reviews.Author: GPA7
Reviews.Content: Good: 1. Great room (playroom), lots of space and an increible bed, the best hotel bed in the world? stylishly designed, super minibar etc. 2. Cowshed toiletries for Mrs G. 3. Good staff. 4. Super brekkie with a nice bakery/kitchen area full of goodies. Busy restaurant int he evenings like the other soho house clubs so make sure to book a table for lunch/dinner. 5. Excellent little spa. 5* massage. 6. Wi-fi etc 7. Good wi-fi. Bad: 1. Concierges seemed to rotate a little too frequently and good restaurant reservations were a challenge at short notice.

Reviews.Title: “A review of the restaurant -good but not as good as it should be”
Reviews.Author: HMax
Reviews.Content: We came here on a thursday evening and it was buzzing. The decor has been updated since our previous visit and it has nice cozy booths. The ambiance and lighting are really good. The menu is quite standard American brasserie style. Its done well, we had a beef tartare, a pasta bolognese, a quinoa salad, and lobster rolls. All good but not exceptional for the price, you really are paying for the venue. There were a couple of disappointments on service where we had to chase up a dish that had been forgotten twice and then we had missing cutlery and when asked, a fork was delivered covered in food!! So many places to eat in New York, I wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “So-So House”
Reviews.Author: Mike699
Reviews.Content: The Soho House is a members only club that also has rooms available a reasonable rate. The location is downtown in the meat packing district, don't let the name Soho fool you. Great location near a lot of shops and clubs. We stayed over the weekend of January 13-15th 2012 for two nights. The front desk and butler service personnel were the best part of our trip. The people working at Soho house are fantastic. The rooms are very quirky and different that your typical hotel room. The room is a large open studio. A bathtub is situated in the room next to the bed and the shower and sink are also in plain sight. Don't be bashful with your partner staying with you as there is no room for modesty in this space. The toilet is the only thing located behind a closed door. The amenities in the room that are great include the 'cow' themed products from their spa. There is a wall unit appointed with everything from shampoo to horny cow rubbing oil for your partner's pleasure. The Soho House has a bar and eating area which is an open comfortable space. Appointed with big leather chairs, sofas and tables it has an aesthetic feel between Ralph Lauren and Restoration Hardware. Settle in and a very nice waiter or waitress will attend to your every need from drinks to food. This is a cool space where NYC members come to hang out during the day, meet before dinner and it really gets hopping at night after dinner. The worst part of the Soho House for the type of travelers we are is the noise at night. The area is brimming with partying and the rooms are also full of late night revelry. The room above us was clearly occupied by someone wearing high heeled shoes that could be heard in our room as they walked back and forth in theirs. I will not stay in the Soho house again for future visits, however if I lived in NYC i would join the club. It's great space and I can only image the rooftop pool area in the summer when it is open.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Flyinghollander
Reviews.Content: Have now stayed at Soho House in NY maybe 100 nights. Its far far and away the best experience in town . Long may it continue

Reviews.Title: “Charming Escape”
Reviews.Author: Thetinyfox
Reviews.Content: I stayed here per a friend's enthusiastic recommendation and, to no surprise, Soho House exceeded all of my expectations. The discreet entrance is just off of a cobblestone road within the Meatpacking district- one of New York's most desirable neighborhoods. Once inside, the charm was immediately evident and we were greeted by an incredibly hospitable staff. Our room was impeccably designed- downtown chic for those with refined sophistication. We had drinks and dinner in the newly refurbished 6th floor- the martinis are brilliant and the art collection impressive. The spa, Cowshed, also recently had a facelift. Go ahead and treat yourself. If you are fortunate enough to go during the summer months, make sure you check out the rooftop pool too. I will surely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good fun but noisy”
Reviews.Author: David&Jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and enjoyed the buzz in the large members area. I also liked our room. If you sleep well then the noise won't bother you but it did bother us on Friday and Saturday nights. However I am probably too old for Soho House. The food was excellent and service friendly. Concierge / reception tries but is slightly amateur. However overall this is fun and in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, comfy and cracking location!”
Reviews.Author: BluebellChloe
Reviews.Content: While the staff are all a bit too 'sexy for their shirts', who cares when you are hanging out in the coolest hotel in new York! First time I stayed here, had my two young kids with me so we spent most days in the rather srummy roof top pool, now that's the life.

Reviews.Title: “Well run, friendly, stylish, good food. What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: nayeeem
Reviews.Content: Well located in the floursihing Meatpacking district the Soho House is supremely comfy and easy place to stay. The service is good and very friendly, the public areas are stylish and relaxed and the food is great. And, like all Soho House establishments, the rooms are very well thought out and equipped. It's expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Again a bad experience at the Soho house NY”
Reviews.Author: angel d
Reviews.Content: Soho house is a great concept ...homy friendly yet elegance and suppose to be excellent services...You will met this requirements at many of the Soho houses'....except the NY one! Consistently pretentious without the management which seems to be more incline of supporting their incredible attitude! Soho Miami a must!!! Soho house in LA wonderful and all others ...just an experience! NY just a waste of time...food is up and down... service just awful and whatever you liked on the menu just do not get attached it always changes! so are the prices on the menu! Just do not get attached...and when you asked...just always the same answer..."it changed yesterday or last week"...in any case this Soho House needs help! it does not feel cozy or a membership place. Just a show off... lacking class and mostly services .

Reviews.Title: “Money, but value?”
Reviews.Author: Trudeauista
Reviews.Content: This place was a rollercoaster ride. Starting with the good: 1. Next door to the High Line and the subway connections on 14th St. 2. Amazing breakfast area, roof-top swimming pool, and spa, all with attentive staff. 3. Spacious rooms with great bathrooms. But then the massive disappointments: 1. Our room was late to be ready for check in. Something didnâ€™t seem right as the manager was in the room as we entered, having just sprayed air freshener. After a few hours it turned out that the room was mouldy. We realised this at midnight and had to move everything to another room. To their credit, the staff upgraded us to a bigger room as compensation. 2. The area is a full of trashy praty-goers getting drunk and being loud until the early morning hours, which is fine unless you want to sleep, because the windows let in all noise. In addition to this, there seems to be a 24-hour construction right across the road, so there was sound of crashing metal all night. In short, we didnâ€™t get any sleep â€“ the great bed, the beautiful sheets, nothing helped when you feel like youâ€™re sleeping on Times Square. In conclusion, this is a great space for daytime activity. For sleeping (as a hotel), it is the worst value for money overnight accommodation I have experienced to date. I will be back for the day, but never for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Ho House”
Reviews.Author: Hazel C
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. The rooms are amazing but the service is beyond bad. We stayed over Labour Day weekend and we could not have felt less welcome. The hotel as less than 25 rooms yet each time we walked in we were id'd. The waiting staff around the pool were beyond awful no idea which tables they were serving. Breakfast service was a joke - juice with no glasses, cereal with no spoons. You would have better service in a YMCA. Avoid at at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Great place highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Hayles_s
Reviews.Content: I visited here a few days ago with a friend and I was impressed at how lovely the setting was at the rooftop terrace! Luckily had some great weather! It also had a swimming pool which added a nice touch however I was put off when some other members of the public decided to jump in in their underwear! Not very professional! Also the toilets were pretty smelly! It is a lovely place to drink, not the cheapest of places but they do a mean mojito!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler33Nyc
Reviews.Content: First, let me say the rooms are stunning. There was a giant king size slay bed in the room with a huge bath tub right in front of the bed. I thought the rooms were particularly large and well decorated. The pool area on the roof is also a lot of fun. It can get pretty packed and if you want a spot beside the pool you'll need to show up early in the morning. The pool service is great, the drinks are awesome and food is also great, much better than what you'd normally expect for pool side food. I would highly recommend the soho house NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A great private club experience”
Reviews.Author: travellingworldnow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Soho House for a special occasion and were not disappointed with our stunning room. It really felt like we were New Yorkers in our own Meat packing district loft. This was our second stay in 5 years and in my opinion the hotel has just got better. The experience is a little different than a classic top end hotel service experience, this place is more private club, home from home, you are treated as a club member- I personally love this approach. It felt like we belonged! We were delayed returning home by snow fall and ended up spending many more days than intended in NYC. The staff went out of their way to make us feel at home and keep us occupied at their own cinema, offering to show films we wanted and with in house events. Soho house made sure we had a room at a very busy time of year, even though we were booked to leave days before we did. We even got upgraded to a suite for a while. In the end we ended up staying for Christmas and getting Christmas presents from the staff and for New year, for the Soho House party, which was free to guests and a great bonus. Oh and the Spa is wonderful. the staff are some of the most qualified in the world for massage (NYC requires many years training like a degree). I highly recommend the lovely Helena for a treatment. One thing that took a while to get used to was that the front desk often ask if you are a member and forget you are a guest, due to the sheer amount of comings and goings at reception. We soon got to know all the front desk staff so this wasn't a problem. We also got some great recommendations of places to visit and restaurants reserved for us, including Thomas Kellers Per se. I love this place and becoming a member and staying again is high on my agenda.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: gadaboutLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Soho House NYC for 11 days for our honeymoon. We wanted some time to chill out but to also have so much to do on the doorstep. Soho House was the perfect choice. It was brilliantly located in Meatpacking District with fantastic restaurants and bars on every corner. We also chose Soho House because the rooms are amongst the largest hotel rooms in New York. I don't think I've ever seen such a well equipped hotel room in my life - our room had everything in it from an umbrella to new underwear! The room is filled with lovely Cow Shed products - so no need to pack bags of shampoo and shower gel. The beds are extremely comfortable and the cleanliness of the room (chamber maid service) was second to none. The staff really made our stay - they are all so friendly and welcoming. The concierge Jonny managed to get us some impossible reservations in the coolest restaurants & 'must see' shows that we had been unable to book ourselves. The only slight issue with Soho House is that everyone wants to get on theroof. But as a guest at the hotel, you can generally get up there first and secure a spot before the masses arrive. Night-time is particularly fun - lying on the loungers with a cocktail in hand on a hot New York evening - a very cool crowd, but also fun and friendly. If you are young at heart, and really want to sample the best of New York - food, nightlife, interesting people - then this hotel is definitely for you. As someone who loves to sample different hotels (sometimes in a single trip) I don't think I will ever stay anywhere else in New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy-chic....my new favorite combo.”
Reviews.Author: laurencochran
Reviews.Content: I came with friends to stay in the NYC Soho House after one of the best experiences ever at the new Miami Beach location. I was hard-pressed to think the service, amenities, rooms, food...could be matched, but my expectations were exceeded with the vibrance of the meatpacking district right outside our doorstep, some of the tastiest summertime cocktails flowing on the roofdeck with remarkable river and city views, and our rooms (between our group we had 3) were impeccable....each uniquely designed and just so so tasteful and comfortable. Not to mention the Cow Shed spa....best massage I've had in niew york. Let me just say....I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Desirable members' club maybe. Good hotel, no.”
Reviews.Author: Jafarcakes
Reviews.Content: The Soho Group's Babington House hotel is excellent, so tried their New York outpost recently - It was a big disappointment. The narrow reception is dark, as is the whole hotel, including the landings, corridors and the restaurant/bar. The rooftop, including the pool (one of the main reasons I went there) was closed, though this had not been flagged on the website. Staff were fine - chirpy and friendly. The room was small and the furnishings old. The eclectic style might have worked when the hotel launched, but it is jarring and faded now. The media system was so complex it needed multiple instruction booklets, which all warned that if you have problems, call a member of staff. In the end, I had to do that â€“ to make the TV work. The place is also noisy â€“ heard people clearly in the corridor and from a party in a nearby room until very late. Although the Meatpacking location is quite cool - especially if you are a Sex in the City fan - the rooms have no view to speak of. The bar/restaurant is dark - good for night time when it buzzes with a hip media crowd. But itâ€™s too dark and dingy during the day. Getting into Soho House (a private members' club) is regarded as cool. Itâ€™s that exclusivity and the associated celebs that give this place its cachet (cf the reviewer excited that J-Lo stayed there). So unless you think itâ€™s really, really fab to stay at Soho House, then Iâ€™d try one of the much newer hotels downtown â€“ eg. Mondrian, James, Crosby Street.

Reviews.Title: “ThÃ© best in a 30 degree n'y”
Reviews.Author: lorikketz
Reviews.Content: Best hÃ´tel in ny. Not cheap but worth the spend.best roof pool and aperitivo in thÃ© city.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Room”
Reviews.Author: hwoodhills
Reviews.Content: Where to start? The bedroom was not a bedroom. More like a loft. The only way to enjoy NYC. The staff are friendly, the food is excellent. The room service divine. I loved the Cow Shed Spa. Great steam room.

Reviews.Title: “Still great”
Reviews.Author: Dylan23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Soho House in New York in 2007 (I proposed there). This was our first trip back. It remains a great hotel. The best thing about it is the location - the Meatpacking District is perfect if you're looking to socialise and shop. We also loved using the pool. The only points of caution are: (i) because its a members' bar, it gets really busy (this can be a positive as it can add to the "buzz" of the place; and, (ii) being in the centre of the Meatpacking District means that it is pretty noisy until very late (there seemed to be a never ending line of limos picking up from the Gansevoort across the way at about 2.30am). So long as you're not looking for pure R&R, this remains an ideal hotel for having a fun stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Ronertm2010
Reviews.Content: Despite the small place, I liked how clean this place was. Great concierge service. The bar is awesome and the staff members very professional.

Reviews.Title: “totaly over estimated”
Reviews.Author: mlo65
Reviews.Content: Really not a high end hotel ; rooms are small and old fashionned, very poor service, desorganized. Unable to transfer a call coming from outside. Small and disapointing swiming pool... for a very high end price

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL. SUPER ARTY. SUPER COOL.”
Reviews.Author: noksLondon
Reviews.Content: Situated in trendy neighborhood in New York, Soho House is the place to be. The rooms were fantastic, ultra spacious and absolutely nothing was missing. Even when I had a gigantic sugar rush I just had to open of the drawers to find it filled up with a variety of candy and chocolates. The views were beautiful and there was also a great choice of books and games. Everything is extremely cool at Soho House. The only negative aspect of this trip was only when the room keys weren't working properly and also the internet connection was also failing. Breakfast is delicious and the rooftop is great for a pre dinner drink

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BathChickBath
Reviews.Content: Good location for exploring NY, helpful staff, lovely rooms, relaxed atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Great place, shame about the people”
Reviews.Author: londonner73
Reviews.Content: Great location, very good size rooms, friendly informal service. However there is nothing relaxed or down to earth about this place which is such a shame. It's full of advertising media luvvies who feel that they amongst the privileged elite allowed to frequent the premises. In truth if you know of someone who is a member (and it seems that half of New York or London has this connection) then you too can go to the stunning rooftop bar and stand there looking divine.

Reviews.Title: “you gotta be cool to get in”
Reviews.Author: COACHTC
Reviews.Content: cool clubowned and run by the brits in great location.hang out in the drawing room with like mind creatives.food excellent,service -on it and general atmos very friendly and made to feel at home.Check out the rooftop pool. No fat cat stuffy bankers in pinstripes allowed here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: lorien39
Reviews.Content: A 4 night stay at the Soho House New York and boy was it amazing. The service, the staff, the room, the spa, the restaurant (breakfast was delicious) the bar, and most importantly the location were all fantastic. I really noticed how good the team work was here. Everyone seemed to work really well together which is why it is well run. Thank you to Jennifer Temen on concierge who looked after us whilst we were here. She really was fantastic from organising tickets to Broadway and also the best restaurants in town. I would definately stay at the hotel again however, the noise was quite bad at times and as a result of 2 nights disturbed sleep (due to the walls being paper thin) , we got moved from a Playroom to a Playhouse which was FANTASTIC and less noisy. The walls in the Playrooms are paper thin so you could hear your neighbour having a conversation plus all the floors are wooden so you hear a lot of noise from above also. The Playhouse was much better and despite the difference in cost, I would definately recommend this room over the others. Its huge!! Despite the noise, this hotel is simply stunning and so are the people! Thank you to all the staff! M Richmond

Reviews.Title: “your home in NY”
Reviews.Author: Chris-Swiss-Traveler
Reviews.Content: the preceding review say it all better than me.... We had a 4 days trip 19th-22th of Dec in the Soho house. We had a playhouse room and we had a good deal of 4 nights for the price of 3. Which makes a normal price. As said in other review the playhouse room are just big. and that's great for a long stay. The pictures from the web site reflect the reality. The bath is in the middle of the room and is big :-). Bed is big and very comfortable. It's true that you can hear your neighbor some times but I have the impression that guest of this hotel were well educated and I never heard people making a lot of noise. The room has everything you need form good stereo, large TV, desk, even a steamer in the shower. The staff were very friendly, but maybe lacking of knowledge as I ask were is the Chelsea market and nobody was really able to understand and in fact it's just after the big apple store, 2 street above. Location is great with a lot of trendy restaurant, bars, boutique and I find meatpacking in the middle of the city convenient. Not far from every interesting place in NY. As we are walking a lot it was a great start for our walk to the north, or the south. The deco at the restaurant and bar is excellent and atmosphere is very cool. I can only recommend this hotel specially if you can profit from a special package deal then a room like the playhouse will make your stay unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Charming and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: RydeTraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked the Soho House between Christmas and New Year on impulse when we saw a great deal deal on their web-site. Contrary to some of the other reviews on this site we found the service to be truly charming, not the slightest bit snooty. The Playground room that we booked had a real 'wow factor' was palatial and every bit as good at it looks on the web-site. The room was easily the biggest we've stayed in in New York, and stocked with what seemed like a lifetime's supply of cowshed toiletries. So comfortable that we regretted leaving every time we ventured out. There were lots of other families with young kids staying at the same time which made for a very unstuffy atmosphere. Every member of staff we came across was friendly and charming and (contrary to another review here) did not solicit tips. We also had no problem with noise (but this is a party venue, so we'd brought earplugs as a precaution !) Great location, which we would not have considered if it was not for the hotel, very close to the new Highline Park (www.thehighline.org) which is built on an old elevated railway line. The slight downside was that its a bit of trek from most of the attractions that we were planning to visit and we had no plans to visit the likes of Stella McCartney or Alexander McQueen which are nearby. Other niggles are minor - small cracks in the sinks and the bath and a lightbulb out on the chandelier.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, service not the best”
Reviews.Author: bdsa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 4 or 5 times. The rooms are gorgeous but the service could be better. That said, the last trip was better than the ones before and we felt they are making more effort on the service side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but perhaps too much of a club and not enough of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: PITN
Reviews.Content: The title sums it up. SH is located in a fabulous part of twon, trendy, not too noisy and busy, but easy to get to the main event. The hotel itself is great. Our room was beautiful, fabulous bathroom (the bath in particular). Very smart, cool and comfortable. I say that but actually we found our bed too hard, but when we complained, they upgraded us the next day and we were very happy. The only thing about the hotel itself that I didn't like was the smell in the corridors. Don't know what it was but it was sort of musty and off sweet if that helps! Otherwise, breakfast was fantastic, we had the continental brekkie and that was perfect, freshly baked muffins...mmmm. The bar is beautiful, fun, and very busy. We also used the free internet service and that was very useful. The upstairs pool deck is really cool, in summer it'll be great. Our only real gripe was that we felt that hotel guests come second to the club members and people who drink there. It is a private club, and was extremely busy, and we were less important than the others. The staff seemed a bit fake and uncaring to us. That's been mentioned before on this forum, (as has the smelly corridor!) so maybe there's something in it (or maybe not). Anyway, we had a great stay, but might try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Total rip off”
Reviews.Author: Jezza08
Reviews.Content: Noisiest hotel we've ever stayed in, we could hear couples arguing all night next door, the walls are so thin we could have joined in! Prank calls to our room in the middle of the night, high heels from the floor above, loud music at all hours, absurdly pretentious staff, smelly corridors, wires hanging from the ceiling, view over a rubbish strewn vacant lot...all this for $800 a night. Don't waste your money on this place! Far nicer places in NYC than this.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: RJB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three friends a fortnight ago, having originally stayed on my own five years ago when it first opened, and I have to say that this remains a fantastic hotel experience - even though its not formally a hotel. It's almost as if someone actually put some thought into what is offered! Let me tell you why Soho House is the best place to stay in New York, at least during the Summer when the pool is buzzing: 1. The rooftop pool is a dream in the Summer. There is nothing like having your (free) continental brekky on a sun lounger by the pool at 9am. And, of course, lots of girlies by the pool come the evening .... (And kids in the morning, note, one of whom threw up next to us!). Cute and highly competent wait staff too. 2. Free access to Soho House events during your stay. There was an Independence Day party on the roof on the Saturday we arrived, a 'sundown' party on the Sunday and various screenings in the private cinema. No charge for any of this. 3. They have a pool table, table football table and loads of board games in the bar, which is rarely busy. And free wi-fi everywhere. 4. Fantastic front desk staff who are always happy to chat and book stuff for you (a Soho House concierge also has more clout, I would guess, than a standard hotel concierge). 5. Always taxis parked outside (it is semi-pedestrianised outside the front door so cabs can park up) 6. No attitude. No-one who works here thinks they are better than the customers. If you've ever stayed at any 'design' property where the staff think they are doing you a favour by serving you, you'll find this a breath of fresh air. 7. The meatpacking district is great for shopping, drinking and eating (at least, it is if converted warehouses are your thing) and its walkable to Greenwich Village and the West Village as well 7. The rooms are well designed - have a look at the website photos - although a liking for warehouse living helps! Great rainfall showers with built in steam room in the larger rooms. Even the smallest ones work well, although the bigger ones (mine was 750 sq ft) make the biggest statements. 8. The selection of freebies I have ever seen in a hotel room. Way beyond the usual toothbrush / razor found at a five-star. Also a selection of USEFUL magazines like Time Out and restaurant / bar guides. Some very interesting mini-bar items as well, including silicone lubricant! The price list also mentioned silk bondage ropes but I never found them! It is well worth considering for your next NY trip if you think it is your kind of scene. They do last minute specials, see website, so if the prices are a bit high for your budget you could hold a flexible reservation elsewhere and then rebook at Soho House a couple of weeks before you travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vendervillej
Reviews.Content: I was there last spring and I have a good memory of my two week trip of leisure and business, the location is my favorite but Ive like seven times to NYC and there are better hotels. Still, the location is my favorite and the service is top 3! Good memories!

Reviews.Title: “The staff was GREAT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mizbombshell
Reviews.Content: I held a private party at this hotel in January 2009. The staff was excellent, asking for my input on how I wanted the room setup and proceeding to provide suggestions on how to make it work for my needs. Everyone was very accommodating and it made me feel very comfortable to know that I didn't need to worry about a thing. When my guests arrived, they continued to be very helpful, courteous, and friendly. The next day, I received emails and phone calls requesting to be invited to the next party, my guests liked the party so much. I was pleasantly surprised, as it was a one time thing, but since the feedback about another party (with food this time they said), I'm planning another one in March. Who would have thunk it? Next time I may stay over after my party.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: britts1288
Reviews.Content: From the moment we called to book the a room at the soho house it was incredible. There rate was different then a rate we saw online, and instead of arguing, they said the customer was always right and gave us the competitve rate. I was having a few girlfriends stay the night for my birthday, and I am100 % sure I chose the right place. I booked the playground and the room right below that, and both were incredibly huge! There was also such a great attention to detail within the room. From the mini bar, to DVDs, and bathroom products, to the draw filled with games... My girlfriends and I literally walked into these rooms and squeeled. It was so fun, and very different, and when more people came up to have drinks with us, the front desk was very friendly. ( i was nervouse that since it was a private club they might be weird about it) We got a noise complaint, but the staff was very kid about it. I cant stress the staffs eagerness to please. I have stayed in a nuber of 5 star NYC hotels, and this was had a special something that will keep me coming back on future stays.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: LondonBrandi
Reviews.Content: stayed here for my honeymoon last july (2008). The spa was fantastic and I had the best back massage I have ever had, also the cowshed products are lovely, but beware that anything you use in the room will be charged for. The attention to detail and location were both excellent and the roof-top bar was very fashionable, and had great views. However, the concierge staff were hopeless and not particularly enthusiastic and the roof-top pool is far too small! Food was good but certainly not exceptional. Go for the trendy factor, the shopping location and the spa. Not particulaly romantic either. A 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: sav21
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. I've stayed there about 4 times now and will keep coming back. Stunning decor and wonderful service, this is a perfect hotel. Unfortunately as its so good sometimes it gets fully booked! Sadly this summer I couldn't get in and ended up at The Roosevelt hotel (don't stay there people, its a dive!). I will make sure I stick to the Soho House only in future!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: LC36LL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights . Overall - a great place to stay. Playhouse Room was v.good ,very spacious ,lots of nice features and furniture although starting to look a little tired . Rooftop pool packed everyday with club members . Rooftop restaurant and bar very good with very helpful staff . Great Mojitos. Excellent location - surrounded by bars ,restaurants and clubs . Area is busy until 4.00/5.00AM

Reviews.Title: “bring ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: bathbrunette
Reviews.Content: off all the places to stay in new york the meatpackers district is the place to be. atmospheric, although rapid property development means the area is losing some of its character, packed with fab shops and restaurants and pretty cobbled streets. Of the 2 hotels in the district soho house is definetly funckier than its neighbour hotel gansevoort. The hotel decor, quality of rooms and location can not be faulted. The only disapointment was the food an evening meal in the restaurant was really poor, although they did quickly take the meal off the bill. We decided not to eat there again but the choice of restaurants in the area makes up for it. Florent, Pastis, Budakkan, Spice Market and Budda Bar are all within staggering distance off the hotel For a real sex in the city experience just around the corner magnolia bakery and carries house on Perry street are worth checkin out. There is only one problem with the hotel and thats the noise. The double glazing and the sound proofing is pants. We arrived jetlagged on a saturday and went to bed at 11pm 5 hours later we were still trying to sleep as the sound of traffic, horns and revellers invaded our room, pergatory! Noise in the hotel is not much better, doors slamming and you can here other people rattling aroung in their rooms. The staff were not very sympathetic about the issue. Its a real shame as we spent most of our day feeling exhausted from lack of sleep. sleep in the city, no chance

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weekend break at SHNY”
Reviews.Author: LondonBlonde
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break in NY to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. I decided to treat us to SHNY as I had heard a lot about it - and it lived up to my expectations. We had a Playroom on the 4th floor - the second grade of room - and I thought that it was very spacious for NY and very good value at the price of $750 plus tax. The decor is quite masculine, chunky and dark - but there is a huge window and we had a great view. The bed was HUGE and comfy and the "maxi" bar had decent bottles of spirits - no icky minature bottles - and a cocktail shaker. The bathtub is shiny and red, and the shower (in a separate room) huge and powerful... and we both enjoyed the selection of Cowshed products and the pullout "vanity" drawer with toothpaste etc. - so much more stylish than lining them up on the sink! Note to girls: this is the first hotel I have EVER stayed in (and I travel pretty much every week with work) that has HAIR STRAIGHTNERS in addition to a dryer provided. We had (what proved to be a three course extravagenza) breakfast in the restaurant - fabulous food and a glass of champagne each for a total of $100. We also tried the bar on Friday evening and the cocktails were fab... it wasn't the coolest place on earth, but it was fun and the drinks were excellent. The concierge could not have been more helpful - making us dinner and brunch reservations, booking a car from the airport etc. All great recommendations and completed with no fuss. The drawbacks? Arrive late on a Friday (like we did) and you will wait in line to check in amongst the liggers attempting to get into the bar. We tried to have a look at the pool early on Sunday morning and the staff there were surly and rude - and for some bizarre reason barked at me aggressively when I tried to take a photo of the view from the roof! To the detractors in other reviews: Yes, the Meatpacking is a noisy area and i imagine that if you are on the 5th floor immediately below the bar (6th) then you would get some noise from there too. Yes, there were some less than polite members around the place. Yes, the TV/DVD/Soundsystem are impossible to decipher. But I'd still go back like a shot - and recommend it to all my friends. I'd even consider taking my mother there.

Reviews.Title: “It was great...”
Reviews.Author: jxnhunter
Reviews.Content: The staff were incredible. The room was the best I've ever had in New York, and given the price - try to compare in lower manhattan - how can you complain?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: theresama40
Reviews.Content: We spent a great night at the Soho House, and we fell in love with the rooftop pool and cafe. The pool itself is very small -- but there weren't too many people actually swimming in it (and we saw only one person get their hair wet). No, this is a place to enjoy the view of river and skyline, to sip cocktails (ordered from the efficient wait staff) and to have a delicious lunch. The chic crowd made me feel a little frumpy, but the attitude quotient was low for a place this trendy, so we had a thoroughly enjoyable afternoon. Our room was pleasant, too, though less special. Our room (one of the smaller ones) was still quite spacious, though that's partly because there's no separate bathroom. Sink, tub and shower stall are all in the main room. (There's a small closet for the toilet.) I think I might find that wearing during a long stay, when I might want to catch a few extra minutes sleep while my husband is showering. Other positives: The bed was extremely comfortable. Service in general was friendly and helpful. Free wireless service. Room is supplied with a few DVD's, in case you have a late-night urge to watch a movie. Location in the Meatpacking district, especially if you're into clubbing. Negatives: The controls for AV system were impossible to decipher. I don't think there was an iPod dock -- strange for a place this up to date. Uncomfortable chairs that are too small for the accompanying table. The "black hole" between the huge credenza and the wall: easy to knock jewelry into it, much harder to retrieve it. Would I come back here in the winter, when the pool is closed? Maybe not, but I know I'll be back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Soho House New York”
Reviews.Author: lovestofly76
Reviews.Content: Myself and a couple of friends decided to go on a shopping trip to New York. We thought it best to take advantage of the exchange rate. I looked for a hotel on Mr & Mrs Smith. We have used them a few of times before, and have always been really pleased with the hotels they recommend â€“ definitely a brand that you can trust for quality. Plus, as a Smith member benefit we received complimentary cowshed products from the hotel, which are really amazing, such a treat! We had a great time in New York and Soho House was exactly as I imagined; the service was impeccable and the hotel was so chic. We loved the rooftop pool as well, it was just how I remember it from Sex & the City! The hotel is located in downtown so its ideally situated for getting around the city. The staff recommended how best to use our time and helped with theatre bookings and restaurant recommendations. A pleasure from booking the trip right to flight back, Iâ€™ve still got some of my free gift left for when I feel like really pampering myself.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Kozmoman
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to try the Soho House Hotel for a recent short stay in NYC and what a big mistake. The staff have just no idea. Booked us a run-down van for our airport transfers, offered us a room with space for five hangers, knowing we were travelling for two weeks etc etc. On top of this the staff were extremely snooty and tried to play this intricate game of "Let's-play-that-we-are-equal-although-I-know-that-I-am-far-more-important-than-you" game. Furthermore, the room that we finally settled into was terribly run down. Although there was a stale smell of paint in the room throughout our stay we never saw any newly-painted walls not to mention the furniture with serious nicks and marks. Enquiring at the front desk, I was told that club members never stayed with them any longer - no wonder. Neither will I.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Dylan23
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Soho House for 3 nights just over a month ago. In short, our stay was incredible. I wanted a special hotel for our visit to New York, as I was planning to propose to my girlfriend whilst away. I contacted a number of hotels, including the Mercer and the Gansevoort, and decide that Soho House was the best option. The reason for this decision was that I not only loved the look of the rooms and location of the hotel but was very impressed by the manner in which the hotel was happy to help me with my plans, so to ensure that my proposal was as special as possible. On the first night we stayed in a Playroom, which was very cool (the photos on the website don't do it justice). On our second day I aranged for my girlfriend to have some spa treatments during the afternoon (including a manicure). Whilst she was in the spa, the hotel staff helped me move our luggae into a Playground room. This room was amazing. It is over 1000 sq ft of urban chic/cool. We (being me and the hugely helpful hotel staff) set the room up with 50+ candles etc and set the scene for my proposal. When my girlfriend had finished having her treatment, Bryony (one of the managers at Soho House, and my partner in crime in arranging the whole set-up) told her that our room had experienced a leak and that we had been moved into another room. She then led her through to the room and from there the proposal went perfectly (she said yes by the way). In addition to all of the above the hotel staff (particularly Michael) were incredible in making all our reservations for us during our stay. Nothing was too much trouble and nothing seemed to be a problem. We have stayed at some remarkable hotels before, particularly Cliveden and Le Manoir in the UK, but this hotel is by far and away our favourite. The rooms, location, bar and spa are special enough, but once you combine that with the service we received you could not ask for more. I would recommend this to anybody that wants to embrace down-town New York and will be forever grateful to Bryony and her team for everything they did to make our stay so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Soho House- the best intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: pooley5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Soho House just before christmas. Arrived way ahead of check-in but they were able to provide us with our room at 10am. Booked a playroom and they upgraded us to a playground which was alot of fun. The front desk asked if they could arrange anything for us, if we'd like to plan to go out that night...very helpful indeed. The restuarant is fabulous and very chilled place to relax in the midst of the buzzing city. The cowshed spa was amazing and the entire hotel smelt heavenly. The staff are very professional and helpful yet not pushy- which I really appreciate. The hotel is next door to Pastis, Markt and the Spice Market. All great understated restaurants. I knowa few reviewers have thought Soho House as being pretentious and the whole 'do u know who i am' syndrome of its patrons. I really didn't witness any or feel this from anyone- the hotel or its guests. I am going back in June and really looking forward to it as i'm taking alot of friends with me. If you are reading this and wondering whether u should stay here or not- Please ignore the bad reviews and go for it. It is a great little gem in the city and shouldn't be missed. It is expensive- but worth it. In New York I have stayed at sixty thompson (great location- and Kittichai restaurant is great), The gansevoort (a little tacky -but adequate -It is also almost opposite Soho House) and the Mandarin Oriental (amazing views & service) and have to say Soho House comes out on top in my opinion- for location, comfort, service, & it's quirky yet chic style. It ticks all the boxes. You get a bit of everything- and its packaged beautifully. My sister struggled to tear herself away from Soho House during our stay- it has that effect- its like a home away from home. You're just so comfortable and have everything there. I'm looking forward to using the pool during my next trip.This place is just unique. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel, snooty staff”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBoiler
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine knows a member of The Soho house, so we booked our room through him. First the pros: The location is fabulous! Right in the heart of the Meat Packing district The room was very spacious (we stayed in a "Playpen Room" on the 5th floor), a loft-style room with a wonderful lay out and many amenities, including an enormous bathtub in the middle of the room. The Cowshed spa products in the room were great. The shower which doubled as a steam room was large with good water pressure. The club upstairs is what I expected in NYC; very posh, great for socializing and people watching. We actually stopped in there every night of our three night stay. Cons: The bed was so uncomfortable. The staff could not have been more rude. Be sure to not use that wonderful Bose system they provide (noise violation) and especially remember not to wear heals. Of all the places I've ever stayed, I've never been told I couldn't wear heals in my room because the VIP guest below us was complaining. We were told twice (11pm on Thurs and 11pm on Fri) that we were being too loud due to the VIP guest complaints from downstairs and that if we did not correct the problem we would get kicked out. Now, I love to have music playing but think I am very respectful of others and kept the volume to a normal level, so I was shocked when I was told we were being too loud at 11pm. The staff deactivated our room keys after our second night and both my friend and I had to ask to have them activated again. My friend was followed to our room by the staff because they didn't believe she was staying there when she came in one morning. As a member of the Soho house I am sure you are treated like royalty, but as a non-member it's much different. Even though I loved the club, room, and location of the hotel, I would never stay here again due to the lack of service and sub-par treatment of the staff. My husband and I loved the Hotel Gansenvoort across the street.

Reviews.Title: “IN the Thick of It here. Our Favorite NYC Hotel By Far.”
Reviews.Author: lmb13
Reviews.Content: OK, this is one of THE coolest & BEST hotel clubs ever. The Decor is fabulous. Really comfortable AND trendy w/out being pretentious. My husband & I are members here & every time we come into the city, providing they have rooms, we stay here. We have sampled every room except The Playground (the largest). They were all fantastic & clever w/all the comforts & mod cons you could want (theyâ€™ve even added ipod docks). My husband & I have stayed in 9 NYC hotels so far: The Ganesvoort, The Maritime, Tribeca Grand, Soho Grand, Chambers, Hudson Hotel, The W Union Sq., New York Palace & Waldorf. We used to live in the city as well & have ate & hung out in many hotels as well. Soho House is by far, our favorite. DO NOT come here if you are looking to rest & relax only. It's pretty much a party hotel. The bar scene is still happening & the Meatpacking District is very hot. New York is noisy PERIOD people!! HELLO?? You cannot control the external goings on of the city!! The rooms....you can hear people turning on the water, or slamming the door....depending on where your room is, you can hear more. Just bring a set of earplugs (if your sensitive) to be safe. Also - never had a problem with bringing in more than the allotted # of guests. Staff have always been really nice & the crowd is cool & minds their own business for the most part (you get a few affected city snobs now & then but who really cares)?! You know why you donâ€™t care...?? Bâ€™c the place is so great. You can even smoke in the Games room. One of the last places in the city where itâ€™s allowed. The Pool is TINY (again, city hotel, donâ€™t expect a giant pool) & beware the children! They had to put a new rule into affect with times & how many kids are allowed. Itâ€™s quite the scene up there so if you get a seat, hold on for dear life but I couldnâ€™t be bothered after a while. It was too noisy w/the kids. I used to go up on overcast days & relax. One of my favorite things about the hotel is the smell believe it or not! The Spa (Cowshed) makes their own organic products on the farm of itâ€™s sister Hotel Babington House (see below). As guests, they give you the array of products to use during your stay & they arenâ€™t stingy...you get big bottles (however, not to take, bâ€™c they recycle the bottles) & you know everyone just tries almost everything. Therefore, the yummy smell of all of those ingredients like Lavender, Calendula, Cinnamon, etc... Seems to have permeated the walls of the Hotel. Anyway â€“ itâ€™s great! If you get a chance to experience it, do so But again NOT if you want a restful hotel. Also - they have a sister club in Somerset, England called Babington House which we've stayed in about a dozen x's. It's fantastic! If you're ever in that area, you should really stay there. Itâ€™s modern living in the country but it doesnâ€™t overwhelm you with how cool it is. You still know you are in the English Countryside AND youâ€™re not having to sleep on Chintz or walk around a drafty & damp old Inn.

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: PIXSQUARED
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel all around the world in the best hotel and I will describe the Soho house as been at the top of the boutique hotel. The room was fantastic, we loved the heteroclit style. The location of the hotel is in hype district full of good restaurant. The lounch bar on teh roof floor is great in summer. The only thing I dislike is the that the swimming pool is invaded by mums and noisy kids who are memebers and none residents of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DomLondon
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by some of the comments posted for Soho House, we had no issue with noise or staff being rude. The hotel had a lovely atmosphere, a low hum of noise in all the right places (it is NY city after-all!) and the staff went out of their way to be helpful; one night they even gave us the entire cinema to ourselves because the tv in our room wouldn't play a dvd, furthermore they brought us room service and blankets which we felt was a nice touch. All the positive comments here re. style of rooms, quality of food etc are spot on, although I loved exploring NY city, I found myself wanted to make regular stop-offs at the hotel to take advantage of the room and restaurant. When I go back to NY, I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “What are they talking about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The Soho House around 15 times since it opened I cannot believe the reviews I read. Yes there are elements that could be improved, but isn't that the case with everything in life. The noise issue has been fixed with new windows, the TV's have even been fixed. The staff are super friendly and helpful and will try and accommodate you in any way possible. In regards to the roof, it isn't Soho House's fault if a TV program made their space look bigger, that program isn't real life!! On the whole, I have enjoyed every stay, even when there is a problem the staff and management have gone out of there way to make it up. I would recommend people try it our for themselves.
